desc.p: Specifies the preferential rate used to determine the Customer Spread for a currency exchange as a percentage of the standard Customer Spread.

Where a customer or group of customers are given preferential exchange rates this field is used to define what percentage of the standard Customer Spread (as defined in the Currency table) should be applied. Where the absolute rate (no Rate Spread) is to be applied the rate specified here must be input as 0%. If the entire spread is to be applied the rate specified here must be input as 100%.
If left blank the Rate Spread will be the same as for a standard customer (as if 100% was entered).
Up to 10 type R characters plus a decimal point (standard rate format), but must not exceed 100%.
Rate input must be in the range 0-100%
Not more than 3 integers may be entered.
Not more than 9 decimals may be entered.
Fields PAYMENT.TYPE to CUSTOMER.FLOAT form a related multi value set.
Payment Type and Customer Float fields define special Value Date conditions applicable to a specified customer or group of customers.
This field provides the facility to define whether or not conversion is involved in the transaction in order to determine if different Value Date conditions should be applied.
ALL means that the condition specified in Customer Float is applicable to all transactions irrespective of the fact that these transactions involve conversion of Currencies.
CONV means that the condition specified in Customer Float is only applicable to transactions involving conversion of Currencies.
NOCONV means that the condition specified in Customer Float is only applicable to transactions not involving conversion of Currencies.
Note : If 'ALL' is specified then no other payment types may be input, otherwise 'CONV' and 'NOCONV' must both be specified, as one is not valid without the other.
'ALL' = All transactions 'CONV' = Transaction involving conversion of currencies 'NOCONV' = Transaction not involving conversion of currencies.
Optional input.

Fields COMM.TYPE to COMM.F.AMT form a related multi value set.
Specifies the rate used to calculate the commission amount as a percentage of the standard commission amount.

Where a customer or group of customers are given preferential commission rates this field is used to define what percentage of the standard commission is applied. Where no commission is to be charged, a rate of 0% should be input. T24 will compare the calculated commission amount with the OVERALL.MIN.AMT and the OVERALL.MAX.AMT defined in the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record. If the calculated commission amount is outside of this range then the minimum or maximum amounts specified in the commission table will be applied regardless. This is to ensure the bank always covers its costs and doesn't charge excessive commissions.
Up to 10 type R characters plus a decimal point (standard rate format), but must not exceed 100%.
Rate input must be in the range 0-100%
Not more than 3 integers may be entered.
Not more than 9 decimals may be entered.
Mandatory if COMM.TYPE is 'ALL'.
Mutually exclusive with COMM.CCY.

Fields COMM.TYPE to COMM.F.AMT form a related multi value set.

Defines the commission type for which a customer or group of customers will be given special conditions. Any commission type not defined will automatically apply the standard commission amounts, according to the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE.
The 'ALL' condition will indicate that the COMM.PERCENT will be applied to all commissions.
A maximum of 11 characters may be entered.
Must be a valid record in the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE table, or 'ALL'.

Fields COMM.TYPE to COMM.F.AMT form a related multi value set.

Defines the amount to be charged for this commission type in the currency specified in the associated COMM.CCY field. Any flat amount defined here will take precedence over the OVERALL.MIN.AMT and OVERALL.MAX.AMT values specified in the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE.
A maximum of 18 characters may be entered.
Mandatory if COMM.CCY is entered, otherwise no input allowed.
Fields PAYMENT.TYPE to CUSTOMER.FLOAT form a related multi value set.
Indicates the Value Date condition, as a number of days, applicable to the Payment Type for the specified customer or group of customers.

This field allows the User to define special Value Date conditions by specifying within payment type a number of days between the Value Date applied to Customer and the Value Date applicable to the bank. If '0' is input, the Group of Customers will receive SAME day value as the bank itself.
Example:
INCOMING TRANSFER
DEBIT NOSTRO ACCOUNT (VALUE 15/1)
CUSTOMER FLOAT = 3 (15 plus 3 = 18)
CREDIT CUSTOMER ACCOUNT (VALUE 18/1)
OUTGOING TRANSFER
CREDIT NOSTRO ACCOUNT (VALUE 15/1)
CUSTOMER FLOAT = 2 (15 less 2 = 13)
DEBIT CUSTOMER ACCOUNT (VALUE 13/1)

0-9 = Number of working days to be added to the Debit Value Date for incoming transfers to determine the actual Credit Value-date and deducted from the credit Value Date for all other transfers to determine the actual Debit Value Date. or 'P' = Processing date irrespective of the other Value Date.
Mandatory input if PAYMENT.TYPE has been input, otherwise not allowed.
Fields CHARGE.TYPE to CHARGE.F.AMT form a related multi value set. Standard T24 currency field.

Defines the currency of the flat amount input in the associated CHARGE.F.AMT. These fields will be used when the bank wants to apply a flat charge amount rather than a percentage of the standard charge.
A maximum of 3 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the CURRENCY file.
Mutually exclusive with CHARGE.PERCENT
Fields CHARGE.TYPE to CHARGE.F.AMT form a related multi value set.
Defines the amount to be charged for this charge type in the currency specified in the associated CHARGE.CCY field.
A maximum of 18 characters may be entered.
Mandatory if CHARGE.CCY is entered, otherwise no input allowed.
Fields CHARGE.TYPE to CHARGE.F.AMT form a related multi value set.
Specifies the rate used to calculate the charge amount as a percentage of the standard charge amount.

Where a customer or group of customers are given preferential charge rates this field is used to define what percentage of the standard charge is applied. Where no charge is to be made, a rate of 0% should be input.
Up to 10 type R characters plus a decimal point (standard rate format), but must not exceed 100%.
Rate input must be in the range 0-100%
Not more than 3 integers may be entered.
Not more than 9 decimals may be entered.
Mandatory if CHARGE.TYPE is 'ALL'.
Mutually exclusive with CHARGE.CCY.
Fields CHARGE.TYPE to CHARGE.F.AMT form a related multi value set.

A maximum of 11 characters may be entered.
